intro: Myosotis annua, commonly known as the annual forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces small, blue or violet flowers with five petals. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Myosotis annua is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is known for its delicate appearance and historical symbolism.
